metadata.Title: CVE-2016-8318 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
Vulnerability in the MySQL Server component of Oracle MySQL (subcomponent:Server: Security: Encryption). Supported versions that are affected are5.6.34 and earlier and 5.7.16 and earlier. Easily exploitable vulnerabilityallows low privileged attacker with network access via multiple protocolsto compromise MySQL Server. Successful attacks require human interactionfrom a person other than the attacker and while the vulnerability is inMySQL Server, attacks may significantly impact additional products.Successful attacks of this vulnerability can result in unauthorized abilityto cause a hang or frequently repeatable crash (complete DOS) of MySQLServer. CVSS v3.0 Base Score 6.8 (Availability impacts).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-8318` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmysqlclient20 - 5.7.17-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-client - 5.7.17-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-client-5.7 - 5.7.17-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-client-core-5.7 - 5.7.17-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-common - 5.7.17-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-server - 5.7.17-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-server-5.7 - 5.7.17-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-server-core-5.7 - 5.7.17-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-source-5.7 - 5.7.17-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-testsuite - 5.7.17-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-testsuite-5.7 - 5.7.17-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: mysql-5.7 package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.7.17-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
percona-xtradb-cluster-5.6 package in esm-apps/xenial is affected and needs fixing.
percona-server-5.6 package in esm-apps/xenial is affected and needs fixing.
